newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH YSE PLANS CUT IN SHARE NOM. VALUE.
newsitem.headline: CZECH YSE PLANS CUT IN SHARE NOM. VALUE.

text.p: Czech investment holding company YSE a.s. said on Tuesday it would propose to shareholders to cut the nominal value of its shares to 400 crowns from the current 800 crowns.
"The main resons for the cut of the nominal value are covering of the (1996) accounting loss and strenghtening of the capital funds," YSE General Director Petr Kulhanek said in a statetment.

The holding company, formerly an investment fund, posted an audited 1.4 billion crown net loss for 1996 after a re-evaluation of its assets to market value from nominal value of shares in its portfolio.

The company had a 51 million crown net profit in 1995. Kulhanek said the firm recorded a gross profit of 10 million crowns in the first quarter of this year, after 240 million crown loss in the same period of 1996.
YSE said it would not pay out a dividend on 1996 performance, ater an 11 crown gross dividend last year.
YSE's general meeting will be held on May 16.
Its shares rose one crown in Tuesday's session to close at 149.
